intro: Anomospermum reticulatum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough, bark-like trunk and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, berry-like fruits. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. The sap of this plant contains milky latex, which has been used traditionally for various purposes.
